Name: Figurine of a hippopotamus
Description: This small limestone figurine, which was acquired in the art trade in 1914, represents a hippopotamus standing on a rectangular socle. The eyes appear to have been inlaid. On the back, one notices an attachment which seems to indicate that the object was used as an amulet. The hippopotamus was the sacred animal of the goddess Taweret, symbol of fecundity and formidable protectress of her progeny. She watches particularly over pregnant woman and over the moment of childbirth.
